text: How: bottle Appearance: clear deep golden, no head. Aroma: apples, apple pie, some melon, grapes, red berries, vanilla, Palate: full body, no carbonation. Superb.
DWF; Bottle 375 ml, served in a beautiful bottle. Pours nothing with tons of sweet apple in a smal bottle, with a lasting apple spice, warming finish. A must try.

July 22, 2016. Bottle, shared by milsem, thanks!  Clear amber with no head, some nice legs. Aroma is fruity with lots of apples wirh sweet baked apples, hints of toffee, touch of sweet pineapples. Taste is sweet juicy apples with caramelized notes, , toffee, pineapple, tart apple skin finish. Full bodied, oily texture. 
Very nice!

Bottle at TradeBookCon#4 160722. Clear copper/deep golden beer with almost no head. Apple aroma, fruity, grapes, vinous, tropical notes, some vanilla. Fresh apple flavor, caramel, apple zest, sourish, sweetish, slightly tropical. Very nice. Well hidden alcohol. Great ice cider.
A: Clear brown coloured N: Apple! Baked apple pie... T: Sweet baked apple, apple apple apple...! O: Very sweet and tiny tart. Extremly nice!

Sample thanks to cparles. Clear copper pour. Aroma is really nice and fruity, tropical notes, pineapple, pear, vanilla, sugar pie aroma. Taste is sweet, really liquory, light caramel apple, fruity, lingering spicy finish, vanilla. Palate is full bodied, nice coating feel. Really tasty.

Sample from cparles, thanks! 

Appearance: Clear bright orange-golden with nice alcohol legs. 

Aroma: Toffee and molasses at first followed by bright apples, bright tropical fruits (papaya?) and a bit of alcohol. 

Taste: Wow! Its really sweet and quite tart as well. The toffee (rather than the usual brown sugar or caramel) combined to the papaya / tropical fruits produces a unique, complex and explosive mix. The caramelized apples are there as well helping the balance. Theres also some alcohol and a mild spiciness (cinnamon). 

Palate: Full body. Thick and oily. Warming finish with a nice tartness. Mouth coating sweetness. 

Overall: Big bold and decadent ice cider. Really sweet and quite tart with a rather unique flavor profile. Very tasty stuff. Among the best of the style. Loved it.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2015 Extreme slimline clear 375 ml bottle, from Vinmonopolet Nettbutikken, at an outrageous price. Vintage 2012, ABV is 10%. Deep cognac colour, no carbonation. Intense aroma of concentrated cider and apple juice, Very sweet and equally intense flavour of concentrated cider and apple juice. Worth the high price? Well, maybe once, but it wont be my daily indulgence. Lovely stuff though.

2012 Vintage. 375mL bottle, pours a beautiful clear dark amber with a tiny head. Nose brings out loads of treacle toffee, caramel apple and brown sugar. Flavour is intensely sweet, with caramelized apples, candied sugar, and a subtle tartness. Much more sweet than most other ice ciders, entering cloying territory but not detracting. Also more tart than most ice ciders. But also very complex. A unique one for sure. Excellent.

Deep golden, aroma of apple. Full bodied and well balanced; sweet and slightly sour. Best cider I have tasted.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lovely thick oily shining deep orange golden pour with the smoothest and perfect balanced apple flavor you can imagine. WoW this really rocks from the start. Full body with a lovely powerful and balanced sweetness. It feels like eating apples, just better. I could sip to one of these the whole day. Perfect dessert. Well I could easily skip dinner also and have this one![From bottle at Haandbryggeiert Cider Festival.ehhh Beer Festival 2014]

Colour me speechless, what did just hit me? What kind of unearthly brew is this? A magnificent mix of apple cider, liqueur and dessert wine! It pours a beautiful, crystal clear orange body, this looks like the nectar of the Gods. No head. The aroma is strong, sweet and acidic and has some lovely notes of both fermented and fresh apples, and a nice whiff of alcohol in the back. The flavour is an everlasting intense overdose of concentrated pure apple, with subtle hints of vanilla in the back. Its incredible that a brew that mainly tastes apples still can be this complex and layered. The taste is heavy sweet and the sweetness is perfectly balanced by a light to moderate acidity. Full body, syrupy texture and no carbonation. Cider will never be the same again.
[Superficial speed-rating of small sample @ Haand Ølfestival 2014, Drammen]
sample at haand. Pours dark golden, uncarbonated. Aroma has some alcohol, apples and portwine. Taste is very deep apple flavour, intense and sweet.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet
Golden. Smells powerfully of apple. Heavy sweet, wonderful apple flavors, nice medium acids from the apple, very nice balanced. Cant really give a deep review since i havent tasted many ice ciders. This one was awsome though

Bottle. Pours a clear orange body, no head. Aroma is blue cheese, dry yellow apples, caramel and hints of apple peel and cinnamon. Flat, full body. Gorgeous stuff, highly recommeded stuff even with the high prices.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 03.08.2013, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Aroma is lots of Aroma apples, oak, grass, apple skin, sugar, nice warming alcohol. Taste is very fresh and concentrated with masses of fresh acidic Aroma apples, sour apple skin, grass, sugar, nice warming alcohol and oaky finish. Lovely stuff!

Bottle @ Papsø. Pours a clear pale amber golden color with a no head. Has a fruity slightly spicy ripe apple aroma. Sweetish fruity slightly spicy tart apple flavor. Has a sweetish fruity tart spicy apple finish.

Botella. Clear amber colour, nice. Pleasantly very sweet apple fruity aroma. Good mouthfeel, sticky bit. Very pleasant flavour, sweet and very apple fruity, well balanced. Sweet apple fruity finish. Some alcohol .

Bottle at Papsø.
Clear orange coloured with no head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of apples and dried apples.
Sweet and fruity flavour of apples and dried apples with notes of malic acid.
Fruity finish of apples.

Bottle 37,5 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a clear reddish amber. Intense overripe apple aroma. Rich body, very sweet, concentrated vanillaish apple. Warming alcohol. Super delicious - almost at the same level as the Canadian ice ciders. 130413
Bottled. An amber cider. The aroma  has. Notes of apples,c vinegar, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of appkes and straw.leading to a bitter fin.
37.5 cL bottle. Pours clear and  golden orange with a small white head. Citric, apples and fruity and tart. Citric and fruity. Smooth apples and citrici finish.

Corked bottle, vintage 2010, courtesy of JesperBright amber color. Nice sweet and acidic aroma of apples, but also some glue. The flavor is very sweet, but also a bit astringent, and the acidity is very high; flavor of apples, some stewed apples. Final with astringent and sour apple skins.Compared to the top Canadian ones, its a bit rough, but very good nevertheless.
Bottle. Deep golden colour with no head. Aroma is apple, alcohol, sugar. Flavour is apple, alcohol, sugar. Intence concentrated apple with nice sweetness. Lovely beverage.

Bottle courtesy of  Gunfryd. Deep golden body with no head. Strong aroma of ripe apples, warming alcohol and a hint of caramel. Flavor is sweet with intense apple, lots of acidity and a hint of marmalade and lots of warming alcohol. Full body and strong aftertaste of sweet apple and acidity. The first few sips took me by surprise of the sweet apple intensity, then it became more pleasant, but after a few more sips it feels rather sticky and alcoholic. Its basically good stuff but just in small amounts. Not as delicate at the Canadian versions I have sampled.

Bottle 375ml. clear glass. [ Vintage 2010 - Bottle #00887 ]. Clear deep medium orange colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy apple, apple syrup - intensely concentrated apple. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet, light to moderate acidic and bitter with a long long duration, dry, apple sweey, intensely concentrated apple, light vanilla and wood. Just lovely ;O) Body is medium to light full, texture is oily - syrupy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20120623]

Aroma of candy apples, some ripe apples, caramel and vinoues notes. Flavor is sweet apples with some sourness, ripe apples and caramelization. Full body, oily texture. Intense .

Bottle 375ml @ fonefan
Pours clear deep golden. Aroma has notes of sweet red apples and vanilla. Taste is heavy sweet and light sour with a long sweet apple and vanilla finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are intensely concentrated apples and has a nice sweetness to it. Gotta love this!
Bottle. Clear amber/brown with no head. Aroma is apples, intense and fruit. Flavour is apples, intense, medium sweet, wood, little vanilla, fruit and a little sugar.

Bottle. A still, oily dark golden colored drink hanging on the glass like a fine liquor. Lots of concentrated apples on the nose, almost carameish, and with something promising sweetness to hit the mouth. A touch of apple cores in the flavor, but mostly baked apples. Some caramel, fresh apples and acidity. Full-bodied, oily and lightly warming on the palate. Lastnig finish with sweetness, apples and some toffee hints. An ice cider Im certainly going to buy again. 120623
